name: Moonshine Snake Plant
climate: The Moonshine Snake Plant thrives in a wide range of temperatures from 60-80°F.
It prefers warm conditions but can tolerate cooler climates down to 50°F.
This plant is suitable for both dry and moderately humid environments.
It can withstand some temperature fluctuations, ideal for indoor settings.
sunlight: Moonshine Snake Plant prefers bright, indirect sunlight for optimal growth.
It can tolerate low-light conditions but grows slower in them.
Avoid placing it in direct, harsh sunlight which can scorch its leaves.
This plant can adapt to artificial light, making it good for offices.
watering: Water the Moonshine Snake Plant sparingly, letting the soil dry between waterings.
Overwatering can lead to root rot; it's more drought-resistant than most plants.
In winter, reduce watering frequency as the plant's growth slows down.
Use room temperature water and ensure good drainage to prevent water logging.
soil: Moonshine Snake Plant prefers a well-draining potting mix to prevent water retention.
A cactus or succulent-specific soil mix works perfectly for its drainage needs.
It can also thrive in a soil mixture containing perlite or sand for aeration.
Avoid heavy, densely packed soil as it can retain too much moisture.
toxic: Moonshine Snake Plant is toxic if ingested, can cause nausea or vomiting.
Keep out of reach of pets and children to prevent accidental ingestion.
extra_care_tip: Wipe the leaves occasionally to remove dust and allow them to breathe.
Rotate the plant periodically to ensure even growth on all sides.
Repot every 2-3 years or when roots become bound, using fresh soil.
